ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: About 6 hours when there was homework due, much more for the final project and exam.
6 hours including finishing homework and reviewing notes.
8-10 hours
8 hours
6h
2-4 hours for weekly homework.
8 hrs
2 hours
8 hrs
4 hours

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Strengths: Dr. Ciarleglio is an amazing teacher, with perfect slides to help us learn the material. She is very meticulous both in the slides and lecture, and she was great at putting things in terms of the big picture. Weaknesses: The final project should be a 2 person assignment without a presentation. It felt unnecessary, stressful, and there are other ways to get us to do a real analysis of actual data.

The slides are very clear and good oriented. I really love the way the instructor managing and presenting the material. And instructor is also very happy to answer students' questions. One suggestions would be the workload. During the final, the workload is a bit heavy as we need to finish final project, last assignment and the final exam. I think maybe we can cut one of them.
Maria is very sweet. Very detailed lecture slides
Useful but too fast
good

Great teaching but exams are unfocused. There should be a practice exam to help focus materials. Not all materials were tested, for example, sample size was not on the final. As there are a lot of information, it would be helpful to know what to focus on. Also for final, since it is cumulative, open book is more reasonable.
Good course but heavy workload

Outstanding introduction to applied survival analysis, the topic is not easy and the instructor is absolutely outstanding in making the topic approachable, her slides are second to none, no book needed
BIS630 is an excellence applied survival analysis course. It focuses mainly on the implementation of several regression models using primarily SAS but also R.
Strengths: Detailed lecture notes. Weakness: The workload for this course is too large.
The workload is reasonable. The final project is not that useful for the overall course and takes a lot of time. The exams do not reflect the homework assingments.
The lecture is very organized.
Materials are great!
Very good notes

The class was great and I learned a lot from it. Material was presented in a good manner. Assessments felt fair. I would personally prefer that there either be a project or a final test, but not both. Especially when the project was not worth very much towards the overall grade.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Amazing. Very patient and kind, a great instructor.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  responsive, responsible, and patient.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  She teaches class with a very clear logical thoughts, especially can make people understand.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Weaknesses: too fast
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  good

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  It would be helpful if the instructor is more specific about what is on the exam consider the homework often relies on SAS and is not a close representation of what will be on the exam
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Very excellent teacher, the slides are exquisite and easy to read

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Maria is absolutely outstanding She makes this difficult topic approachable, her slides are impeccable, no book needed One of the best lecturers ever (both ysph and ysmed)

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Dr. Ciarleglio is an excellent professor. You do not need extra books to follow the class; her slides are excellent and good material to study. She is very knowledgeable in the field of biostatistics and survival analysis.

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Maria is very nice. However, she is not very considerate regarding the course workload. Normally, if a course has a closed book final exam, there will not be a final project. Vice versa. Too many course workload really affects our study efficiency.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Excellent
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Excellent! Maria is very thorough and clear in her class lectures. She is also always willing to meet with students outside of class to help.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Her teaching is very organized and clear.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Overall charming.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Very well prepared
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Great instructor nothing of note on improvement.

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Lectures were well-organized and Maria presented it in a clear way. The midterm and final project were both helpful since they allowed us to review what we learned periodically.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Excellent course, you will learn a lot from a great instructor.
Highly recommend to students who have little knowledge of the survival analysis and want learn technical skills.
Maybe, too much workload
good
Great course but the homework is not a good representation of the exams and knowledge need to know.
Good course to learn survival, useful for research
amazing teaching, this is a relatively difficult topic but the teaching style and slides are simply outstanding

Excellent applied survival course. BIS630 is not mainly oriented in the theory of survival rather the implementation in SAS or R. Great course for APMPH applied biostats/epi students, or those in similar concentrations.
I will recommend this course due to its clear lectures and notes. However, the workload for this course is too large.
Overall good introduction to a difficult subject.
Yes, I would recommend it to other students.
Good!
Yes, useful course.
Valuable material is taught in this class and it is necessary information to work in the field of biostatistics.
